poem:
### Shadows and Gateways

Kosovo in the morning light—  
a future shadowed,  
promises linger like clouds.  

Serbia's refusal,  
cold stone on a path,  
yet the dawn whispers  
through fractured branches—  
a gateway to European dreams.  

Roads diverge, converge,  
talks, thaw, thaw again.  
Hope flickers,  
in the northern breeze.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on Kosovo’s election result: a gateway to rapprochement with the EU Seventeen years after Kosovo declared independence from Serbia, its future remains shadowed and compromised by relations with Belgrade. More than a decade of normalisation talks have so far been a road to nowhere, stymied principally by Serbia’s refusal to recognise its former territory’s right to the attributes of nationhood. In the country’s four northern Serb-majority municipalities, the deadlock has occasionally turned". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
